fields.summary: Jira tags not included in RHS of IssueNavigator

fields.description: The CSS style sheet does not specify the default text color, but it does override the background color. This has the consequence, for me, that the page has white background and the text has light gray background. Worst case scenario the text could be white on white background, making the site useless. A single line (color: black;) in the CSS will fix this.
fields.summary: Default text color not set in CSS

fields.description:
I want to be able to restrict access with a permission instead of making a new group and adding that to n-1 projects... just so I can have noe user who only sees one project.

Is there a way to do this currently?

Hi,

We'd like to run JIRA using Sybase as the datastore, although we know it is not tested by you.  We have had some success with the field type definition file (below).  

When we start Tomcat, JIRA creates all the tables without any problems.  We get the initial setup page, but when we click to enter the admin user, we get NullPointerExceptions in the console and the browser is empty.  

We have the environment set up and working fine on Oracle.  We did this first, seeing as the field type definition file already existed for that database.

Have you any ideas what might be causing the problem?  I cannot find anything on the web or here about using JIRA with Sybase.

Many thanks,

  Michael Brown

fields.summary: Problem when signing up for new user Account from login page

fields.description:
Problem:
As 1.2 uses OSCache & uses a listener to flush the cache, the listener needs to be installed.  The upgrade manager detects & performs the addition of the listener, but not if you are installing from scratch (ie no previous import of data).

The means that caches for Browse Project, and the Home page / Dashboard will not be refreshed, and will be up to an hour out of date.

Affects:
Version 1.2, only if you have not imported any data from a previous version (ie 1.1).

Work Around:
Navigate to "Administration" -> "Jira" -> "Listeners".

Look for a listener:

  Name: Issue Cache Update Listener
  Class: com.atlassian.jira.event.listeners.cache.IssueCacheListener

If such a listener does not exist, create one.
fields.summary: Cache Listener not installed on clean upgrade

fields.description: Add time tracking for issues (has been requested quite a few times).

Add an automated http interface.

Interface should be 'namespaced' at /url - vs /soap (JRA-369) or /secure (web GUI interface).

Related to JRA-390 and JRA-369.
Get JIRA running in the Resin (http://www.caucho.com) web container.
It would be fine, if the user can set an option, whether he wants to see all issues, he reported or only those that aren't fixed and released yet (I could not imagine the first case, but who knows?).

If I view the JIRA Configuration and press "Edit Configuration", JIRA 1.2 does not set the mode and the attachment path.

Same problem as before, this time with com.atlassian.jira.event.listeners.cache.IssueCache, which is put in the ejb jar, yet refers to oscache.

This stuff is REALLY easy to catch. You should just change your buildfile nad use different classpaths to ensure that web stuff is not exposed to ejb stuff, so things like this stop slipping through

fields.summary: Cannot edit a Project from a Project View

fields.description:
Here's a suggestion for improving performance for jira, why not have a
caching filter that caches common osuser calls?

I was trying to integrate in the new beta of jira 1.2 with my own user
management system today, and while tweaking about I changed the
implementation of my osuser AccessProvider, which result in the
listGroupsContainingUser call to be a bit more expensive (cache hit + db
call instead of just a cache hit), and jira performance plummeted. A few
debug statements later, and I noticed that that method was called at least
12 times and on some pages up to 30 times (viewing an issue was 28 calls!)

So a suggestion on improving this would be for jira to have a filter, which
performs such lookups that happen regularly and places them in the request
scope. Further pages could then just get the values out of there. The only
downside to this approach is that if some other user changes permissions or
groups mid-request, then that won't be picked up by jira until the next
request, which really isn't that bad (in fact, it's more predictable
behaviour). So..how about it for the next beta!

For the reported by dropdown, it requires a findall to get all the reporters for a project.

Could either cache the list - but preferably, change it to a text box.  This has the advantages that if there are many reporters, the textbox is not cumbersome.

Using a text box - search on user name, email, or full name.

Should result in a 1-2 second decrease in the issue navigator page.
fields.summary: Filter navigator speed improvement - remove reporters dropdown

inline Decorator: /decorators/panels/navitem.jsp
	at

or(Unknown Source)
	at
com.opensymphony.module.sitemesh.taglib.page.ApplyDecoratorTag.doEndTag(
Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.jsp.admin$jsp._jspService(admin$jsp.java:516)
	at

I just got 1.2 Beta 2 up and running on Tomcat in about 2 minutes -- muuuuch
better than my experience on JBoss & Weblogic. ;)

Anyway, I just encountered the following problem:

javax.servlet.ServletException: (class: org/apache/jsp/navigator$jsp,
method: _jspService signature:
(Ljavax/servlet/http/HttpServletRequest;Ljavax/servlet/http/HttpServletRespo
nse;)V) Illegal target of jump or branch
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.service(JspServlet.java:485)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)

I clicked on the issues naviagtor page - here's the URL exactly:

http://morpheus:8080/atlassian-jira-web/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=tru
e&pid=10000&statusIds=1&assigned=bill

This type of error results when there is too much compiled code per method.
All of these pages are essentially one call to the service() method of a
servlet and if you use a lot of tags or templates, a lot of code will be
generated in the service() method.

A couple of solutions are suggested on this page:
http://www.mail-archive.com/struts-user@jakarta.apache.org/msg04902.html

Has anyone else seen this? I'm using Tomcat 4.0.3.

Regards,
--Bill

Create a basic SOAP API to be expanded over time.

Initially the API will just have a few different methods to create issues, and a single method to 'ping' the server (which will also serve as an authorisation check).

Built using Glue (http://www.themindelectric.com/glue) of course.

A tool which would enable you to edit certain issue fields in bulk.

A sample use case is for changing the fix for version or assignee of a group of issues at once. (ie moving 10 issues to the next version)

(suggested by David Dabbs)
In the admin pages, all 3 users links on the left hand side nav should be hidden if external user management is enabled
fields.summary: Users left nav should be disabled with external management

The excel view doesn't show up nicely. The correct way to get it to play nice is to add a content-disposition=inline; filename=report.xls header, so it shows up inline within the browser and saves with the right filename.

There is no option to reassign issues when deleting a version to another version. It says at the top though to specify what is to be done with issues matching the version to be deleted, so it kinda makes sense to be able to reassign them in one go to another version.

Also, the remove version from all issues button should be a checkbox, not a radio button, so it can be selected/deselected.
'They will be overriden any global permissions' should be 'They will be overriden by any global permissions'

I have a number of projects, and once I go to one of them, any other clicks on the quick links on the dashboard take me to that project page. Eg, I have project A and project B, if I click on open issues/road map/changelog/popular in project B's listing if I've been to project A first, I get shown project A's page, not B. Looks like it's using a value from the session which is overriding that passed in as a parameter.
fields.summary: All project links on dashboard go to the same project view

Going through setup with a clean install of jira 1.2, with my own osuser impl. I go through setup, but then at the last step I am told that jira detected that I already have an admin user, and prompts me for username and password. However, entering my admin login info does not work, I get the error message 'User specified is not an administrator'.

Looking through the decompiled source (sorry Mike!) I think this is an issue whereby jira tries to use the permissions manager before it's had a chance to be properly setup. I think what should happen is that the same check that took place to figure out that a user exists should happen, nothing more than that.
fields.summary: new permissions causes blocker in setup

fields.description:
From the "View Issue" page it is not possible to vote or unvote when an issue is resolved. When using the "Issues Voted For" filter in the profile page there's a possibility to unvote for all types of issues.

I think the behavior should be the same in both places. Don't know which is the correct one, though...

Perhaps the "Issues Voted For" report should show the status of the issues as well.
Doesn't work.  Due to a problem with permissions.
It would be nice to have user supplied icons for user defined values for Issue Type etc.
fields.summary: Add icons to user defined Drop down values

fields.description: Delete version does not take into account fixfor versions.
Project summary screen currently lists users in the 'By Assignee' section with user IDs, i believe it should user User Names instead. user IDs should not be exposed in Public setup of JIRA.
fields.summary: user names vs. user IDs in the project summary

fields.description: When I click on "find issues" menu button the delay is always unusually long. I noticed this not only on my machine but also on your live demo which I am using right now to report this improvement. I develop java web applications for a living and this delay is unacceptable

When you click on the forgot password link in the login screen it takes you to a screen that asks for your email. If the case is incorrect it reports that there is no user with that email address which is wrong. All email addresses are case insensitive. RYAN.ACKLEY@JBOSC.KSC.NASA.GOV is the same as Ryan.Ackley@jbosc.ksc.nasa.gov and ryan.ackley@jbosc.ksc.nasa.gov
fields.summary: When JIRA asks for your email address to send you a new password, the email field is case sensitive.

fields.description:
Add a new buton 'In Progress' which changes an issue's status from assigned to in progress. The button should only be shown to people who are assigned an issue, and can be unset by assigning the issue to someone else.

Also might be nice to change the text of the Assign button to ReAssign for issues that are already assigned.
Probably via the administration console
fields.summary: File Upload max-size should be configurable

fields.description:
At the moment, a user has to click on "Get Password" when they are first created.

The user should get sent a password when they are created.
fields.summary: User's Password should get sent to them when user is created

fields.description: It would be really nice if the autogenerated emails for an updated issue contained information about what was changed.  There is a workaround in that it sends the link to the history, but I'd appreciate having information about the issue right on hand.
fields.summary: Update to the bug report emails.

fields.description: when an 'Update' email is sent it should specify what specifically has changed. it seems like that info is available since Change History already has it. including that info into email would be very useful.
fields.summary: 'Update' email notifications should specify what has changed

fields.description:
it would be quite important in a Public setup of JIRA to have moderation ability. here are the events i'd like to moderate:

- new user accounts. a moderator would need to approve the account before the user can login
- new issue creation. a moderator would need to approve/confirm the issue before it becomes visible to everyone in the User group

this list could go on for pretty much every action a person from the User group could do.

thanks,
mark

in a public JIRA install i'd like to have an ability to mark an issue 'private'. the private issues would not be visible to anyone in the Users group. here's why i think it would be an extremely useful feature:

we have a single installation of JIRA where we'd be managing bugs for our products. some bugs could come from our users/customers, some would be entered internally. whenever we enter an issue internally it may not need to be visible from 'outside' (by anyone in the Users group). 

thanks,
mark
fields.summary: need ability to mark an issue 'private' in a Public JIRA install

fields.description: It would be great to allow a user to select a check box on the login page so a cookie could be set on the browser. this could streamline logon process.
fields.summary: 'Remember me' check box for the Login screen

fields.description: would be nice to see "find issues" skip the project selection screen if there are no projects to choose from (assume the use wants to find issues on the only existing project)
fields.summary: Issue Browser project selection for JIRAs with only 1 project

fields.description:
When looking at the issue navigator, I find it difficult to distinguish at a glance the difference between assigned and resolved issues (by looking at the far-right column). This is partly because the words 'assigned' and 'resolved' are similar lengths, and partly because the icons look similar too.

Perhaps changing the green arrow on the 'assigned' icon to a yellow one would be enough?

The Dashboard is the centre of User operations for JIRA.

It contains:
- tasks to do (eg administration tasks)
- summaries of your issues (assigned, reported etc)
- project summaries with short graphical summary
- links to projects

See attached screenshot for a sample.

It would be useful to have a freeform text area that you could enter text into - like the Unix / IRC Message Of The Day (MOTD).

This would appear in the dashboard (user home page) show that new users could get a description of the installation, and it could be updated (infrequently) with new information for users.

fields.summary: Printable URL contains context path twice

fields.description:
com.atlassian.jira.config.ConfigurationException: Could not configure listeners: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultConfig.loadListeners(DefaultConfig.java:138)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.DefaultConfig.<init>(DefaultConfig.java:49)
        at com.atlassian.jira.config.ConfigFactory.getConfig(ConfigFactory.java:26)
        at com.atlassian.jira.service.LoadTimer.contextInitialized(LoadTimer.java:73)
        at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.listenerStart(StandardContext.java:3197)

Also, I cannot get log4j to be configured right. where should I be putting my log4j.properties? tried common/lib and server/lib and shared/lib and WEB-INF/lib

Ian

It would be nice if a user could select a project as the default project, and not have to select it in the browse project/find issues screens at every login.

Perhaps the default project could be stored in the user's profile.

http://jira.atlassian.com/secure/ManageAttachments.jspa?id=10741&del=10021

the delete link shoulnd't be showing. the delete action is correct though because it errors when I try to delete an attachment.
fields.summary: Delete Link showing up for non-developers on Manage Attachments Screen

fields.description:
The project browser currently does a LOT of queries.

This can be almost completely optimised away.

Instead of querying for each statistic, a single query should be made and then iterated through to generate statistics. One query should do the whole right column, and each report should also take a single query.

That cuts about 20 queries per request down to 2.

'tis good.

For larger software projects, there are often large features that will require several smaller tasks. This could also be accomplished by creating sub-tasks.

An example. Jira could use a discussion forum under tasks so that developers could communicate without using email, and be able to archive conversations about functionality for later. This new feature would require several things. The first step would be design, follwed by database structures, then interface, and finally testing/promotion.  

Each step would be setup, however, step 2 or 3 could not be started or edited until step 1 was completed. 

This feature is really about group tasks together and being able to effectively manager bigger tasks with small sub-tasks.
when using external user management, the home page should not have a create new user link. The user browser should also not have a delete link
In EditApplicationProperties, I'm prompted to enter an attachment path. However,there is no hint whatsoever about what this path should be. Should it be relative? Absolute? Within the web dir?

It will make reports easier to view.

Installed a clean copy of Orion 1.5.4. The only changes I made to Orion were setting up a datasource/JDBC driver.

Installed JIRA (as an EAR). After deployment, upon accessing JIRA for the first time, I get the following:

Unable to configure log4j
log4j:ERROR No appenders could be found for category (webwork.dispatcher.ServletDispatcher).
log4j:ERROR Please initialize the log4j system properly.

JIRA itself ran through the setup and continues to work fine.

When deleting a project version or project component, they are not flushed from the cache. This gives the appearance that they have not actually been deleted, but they *have* been removed from the underlying database.
fields.summary: Cache is not flushed when deleting a component or version

fields.description: Add a mssql datasource in entityengine.xml
fields.summary: Mssql isn't listed as a datasource in entityengine.xml

fields.description:
As per Lionel's email on the mailing list.

Get a default tyrexdomain.xml out of the OFBiz common app.

fields.summary: entityengine.xml comments for Tomcat are wrong

fields.description: I don't want to add all my users to the "jira-users" group, so how about a way to configure JIRA to specify what the standard JIRA group is. That way my application and JIRA can both use the same group name.
fields.summary: Allow config file to specify what group is "jira-users"

fields.description:
The version of OSUser you are using is old school (before April 4th). The interface has changed slightly (getGroups() and getUsers() returns Lists, not Collections). I think it's a compile thing, so the switch should be trivial.

-Pat

Highlighting navigator rows (with a soft background colour) is a cool feature - but some users might want to turn it off - I can see how it can be annoying.

Add this as a user preference.
fields.summary: User preference to highlight navigator rows

fields.description:
Just like for the changelog and roadmap - highlight it in a dark red to make it stand out. 

Maybe change the whole row colour?
fields.summary: Highlight unresolved in the Issue Navigator

fields.description: An icon to put in the top right hand corner for a printable page.
The dates in the issue navigator are too long - shorten them to just dd/mmm/yy (ie 18/May/02). We need to make the columns narrower however possible, and the times aren't really relevant.

It's, like, not sorted ;)

In code - u2.compareToIgnoreCase(u2) <- not good!
fields.summary: Sort by reporter doesn't work at all

fields.description:
Would be nice to have printable pages.

ie an icon in the top right hand corner of a printer, which when clicked, gives a printable version of the current page. 

clicking again gives the normal version. 

Also the printable page should have a "return to normal" link on it.

Would be useful for reports etc.
